This happened directly after startup? You didn't do anything?
Was the file in source, binary, external or a revision?
Quick Diff enabled?
Folding enabled?

What JRE are you using?

This is either a JIT bug or someone called AnnotationRulerColumn.setModel(null)
in non-UI thread.

I think the only thing I did before I noticed the exception was to open a debug view. The visible 
editor was on a source file. The quick diff and code folding options are set to the defaults (they both 
appear to be on).

I'm using JDK 1.4.2.
Was this the only log entry? Not reproducible, right?

Cannot reproduce. setModel(...) was never hit in non-UI thread while running in
debugger.

Note: the stack trace does not tell for sure whether this has been caused by the
Java or some other editor.
Resetting priority to P3. Will be reassessed for the next release.
